result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William George Leary

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William George Leary in court.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich in court for William George Leary.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 

DTC - PHASE ORIENTATION

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant. The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program. Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant William George Leary appeared by video.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich in court for William George Leary.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DTC - PHASE ORIENTATION

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant * points.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant William George Leary in court.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich in court for William George Leary.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months. 

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of rights

Defendant William George Leary appeared by video.  Attorney Connor Romenesko appeared by video for William George Leary.  Attorney Jon R Josephsen Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defendant's case to be transferred to drug treatment court; next court date scheduled October 12, 2022 at 2:30 pm, Branch 17, in room 400 of the Courthouse.

Defendant William George Leary in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel requests a Status Conference date, to allot time to schedule a tad evaluation for possible dpa resolution. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant William George Leary in court, appear by video with attorney Connor Romenesko, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William George Leary in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko; both appear by video. Navjot Hira appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was not present due to state witness on vacation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.

Defendant William George Leary in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/28/2022@01:00pm
